org.trianacode.taskgraph

Interface TaskGraph

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ExecutionListener, Task, Tool
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    TaskGraphImp

    public interface TaskGraph
extends Task, ExecutionListener
    An interface to TaskGraphs

      • createControlTask

        Task createControlTask(Tool tool,
                     boolean preserveinst)
                       throws TaskException
        Constructs a new task for looping over the group, optionally preserving the original instance id in the new task. This method does not connect the control task, which should be done using TaskGraphUtils.connectControlTask()
        Throws:
        TaskException

      • removeControlTask

        void removeControlTask()
        Removes the loop task from the group

      • getControlTask

        Task getControlTask()
        Returns:
        the task responsible for looping over the group

      • isControlTask

        boolean isControlTask()
        Returns:
        true if a loop task exists for this group

      • isControlTaskConnected

        boolean isControlTaskConnected()
        Returns:
        true if the control task is connected

      • isControlTaskUnstable

        boolean isControlTaskUnstable()
        Returns:
        true if the control task is unstable

      • getControlTaskState

        int getControlTaskState()
        Returns:
        the state of the control task (CONTROL_TASK_CONNECTED, CONTROL_TASK_DISCONNECTED or CONTROL_TASK_UNSTABLE)

                throws TaskException

        Returns:

              boolean preserveinst)

        Returns:

      • groupTasks

        TaskGraph groupTasks(java.lang.String[] tasknames,
                   java.lang.String groupname)
                     throws TaskGraphException
        Groups the specified tasks, returning the taskgraph created. A default mapping between group nodes and task nodes is created. This can be changed later through setDataInputNode etc. in TaskGraph.
        Throws:
        TaskGraphException

      • unGroupTask

        void unGroupTask(java.lang.String groupname)
                 throws TaskGraphException
        Ungroups the specified group task
        Throws:
        TaskGraphException

        Returns:
        the parent of a group input/output node

      • swapGroupNodeParents

        void swapGroupNodeParents(Node groupnode1,
                        Node groupnode2)
        Swaps the parents of two group nodes (without disconnecting either). Useful for reordering input/output nodes.

      • ungroup

        void ungroup()
        removes tasks and notifies listeners when the taskgraph is ungrouped, but does not dispose of the tasks

        void dispose()
        cleans up any operations associated with this taskgraph and the tasks within it
